text: The first chapter is an introduction to statistics which is needed to understand the later parts of the book. It's boring to _me_ but I feel obligated to read it so I can make an informed decision as to whether to recommend the book to others

but I feel obligated to read it so I can make an informed decision as to whether to recommend the book to others

text: Started reading _Monte Carlo or Bust_ on kindle on morning of release. 13% of way through, it's OK so far could be pretty good, will report back later in week which is when I should finish it by.

text: We could probably do with a channel just for books and papers worth reading TBH. There's a lot out there, and most of it utter crap.

text: I was wondering which approach you guys use, to extract goal scored information from the market streams. Do you check how to correct score market reacts or do you extract the information from the over/under markets?

elements.text: I was wondering which approach you guys use, to extract goal scored information from the market streams. Do you check how to correct score market reacts or do you extract the information from the over/under markets?

text: I combine information from both correct score and also O/U, and also use the score API.

elements.text: I combine information from both correct score and also O/U, and also use the score API.

text: And what do you do for backtesting? Which score API are you referring to btw?

elements.text: And what do you do for backtesting? Which score API are you referring to btw?

text:
There's an unofficial API which provides scores for the Betfair website. Can't remember the url off the top of my head. I recall that there is an example in the bflw library. 

For backtesting I just use the same code as I would in live. Decipher the score from correct score, O/U and score API.

elements.text:
There's an unofficial API which provides scores for the Betfair website. Can't remember the url off the top of my head. I recall that there is an example in the bflw library. 

For backtesting I just use the same code as I would in live. Decipher the score from correct score, O/U and score API.

text: Alright thanks for the pointer. :v: Deciphering from correct score and O/U is a little bit of a hustle. Kinda confusing from time to time. Hope I can get something stable working.

elements.text: Alright thanks for the pointer.
Deciphering from correct score and O/U is a little bit of a hustle. Kinda confusing from time to time. Hope I can get something stable working.

text: Tip: If you're not sure what the score is don't bet at that time.

elements.text: Tip: If you're not sure what the score is don't bet at that time.

text: haha thanks mate. Makes sense ^^

elements.text: haha thanks mate. Makes sense ^^

text: I was billed £0.01 today for going over my transaction allowance yesterday. Betfair really are counting the pennies! :joy:
